short_summary: Canadian Coast Guard has a requirement for the dry docking refit of CCGS Capt. Jacques Cartier
description: In order to achieve cleanliness and efficiency, the Canadian Coast Guard requires a Dry Docking Refit of the CCGS Capt. Jacques Cartier.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## CCGS Captain Jacques Cartier Dry Docking Refit
### Request for Proposal
#### Solicitation Number: WS4231400616

The Government Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the dry docking refit of the Canadian Coast Guard’s (CCG) vessel, CCGS Captain Jacques Cartier.

#### Tender Overview
* Tender Closing Date: November 30th, 2023, at 14:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: January 2nd, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: N/A
* Condition: Tender is expired

#### Information
- **Province and Country of Work**: Quebec, Canada
- **Vendor Category**: Goods and Services
- **Unspsc Code**: * 25111900 (Marine craft systems and subassemblies); 78180000 (Transportation repair or maintenance services)
- **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
- **End User Entity**: Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)
- **Contractor Contact Information**:
  * Dave Dunne (SPAC/PSPC)
  * Email: dave.dunne@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Procurement Method
This is a competitive request for proposal (RFP). Tenders will be evaluated based on lowest price.

### Region of Opportunity
No specific region has been identified for this tender.

### Procurement Documents
Tenders can be downloaded from Discovery Document below at:

https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17702456?extsite=MTc3MDI0NTZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Deadline for Question Submissions
24 hours prior to the closing of the RFP.
